Horsfall signs off to signal the end of an era

As I watched my penalty bobble harmlessly wide, probably my last kick of a college football after nine seasons, I couldn't work out whether this was the worst possible end, or perhaps the most fitting (Thumbnail credit Dan Horsfall is the most respected referee in College football. Photo: Peter Iveson)

The Mixer

The Mixer would like to make a heartfelt and profound apology on behalf of some of the other "talent" that scribbles stuff on these hallowed pages (Thumbnail credit "Usually I don't take a bad penalty" - Famous last words. Photo: Pips Ladton)

McIlroy unstoppable after 36 at US Open

Rory McIlroy told you everything you needed to know about his demeanour when, last night, after facing the inevitable questions about how he would perform after the Masters he responded with intelligence and maturity (Thumbnail credit Rory McIlroy. Image credit: Zzazazz)

Halifax book their place in the final after victory over Vanbrugh

Halifax Firsts have booked their place in the College Cup final after beating their Vanbrugh counter parts 2-1, thanks to a stunning goal from striker Conor Brennan and a header from Captain Tom Ragan.

Wimbledon 2011: The Contenders

With this year marking the 125th anniversary of the Wimbledon Grand Slam, tennis is as competitive as ever and for the first time in many years there are multiple players who could win both the men's and the women's crown (Thumbnail credit Andy Murray will carry British hopes on his shoulders again this year Image: N Howson via Flickr Creative commons)

On another highly successful inter-college sports day, Halifax again flexed their sporting muscle by besting their collegiate rivals

College Cup Podcast

By James Bithell

Going into the penultimate week of the 2011 College Cup the Nouse Sport team look back on the previous week's quarter-finals and discuss what could go on in the last four of both competitions

The Secret Footballer

By James Bithell

Penalties are a grim, unforgiving lottery. I've been involved in a few during my illustrious career in the Hertfordshire Junior leagues, but none come close to one in the College Cup

Halifax overcome stern Wentworth test to book semi-final place

Wentworth gave College Cup favourites Halifax their toughest test this afternoon, but ran out losers to a side that displayed impeccable strength all over the pitch

King Jon Gill dictates play as Vanbrugh seconds win shoot-out

In one of the most dramatic games seen on the JLD in recent times, Vanbrugh seconds managed to snatch a coveted place in the semi-final of the Plate after keeping their cool in the pressure cooker environment of the penalty shootout

All-round performance from Hughes helps York's cricketers to cup final

A fine display with the bat and ball from Joel Hughes earned an understrength York a semi-final victory over the University of Bradford and a shot at BUCS Northern Conference Cup glory in next week's final

Day to Treasure for Derwent as they make it to last four

A nerve-shredding penalty shoot-out ended 6-5 to Derwent firsts as Seb Treasure saved Paul Reiss' decisive kick to send his side through to the semi-finals

Halifax thirds get past Derwent to seal semi-final berth

Halifax thirds knocked out Derwent thirds in today's Plate quarter-final, holding off late Derwent pressure to secure a 2-1 victory

Halifax seconds progress to semi-final to end James thirds' dreams

The chance of an all Halifax College Cup final is still on after Halifax seconds brought James thirds' heroic cup run to an end to progress to the semi-finals

Hors-falls at the final hurdle as Derwent seconds seal spot kick triumph

A heartbreaking penalty miss from College Cup stalwart Dan Horsfall saw Wentworth seconds pipped 5-4 on penalties by their Derwent counterparts in today's Plate quarter-final

Jon leaves Goodricke green around the Gills as Vanbrugh progress

Vanbrugh firsts booked their place in the semi final beating their Goodricke counterparts thanks to a Jon Gill header, as only one goal separated the two sides on the JLD

Late Clarke winner sends James through in the plate

James Firsts progressed to the Plate semi-finals after edging a closely fought game with Langwith Firsts 1-0

College Cup Podcast

By James Bithell

An extra-special edition of the College Cup podcast in which the Nouse Sport team run the rule over the last week of group fixtures, and look forward to Week Seven's quarter-finals. As well as that there's a blast from the past as a captain from last year's tournament joins us on the phone.

Classy Halifax cruise into the knock-out stages

Halifax firsts did nothing to harm their College Cup credentials today, beating a solid Vanbrugh seconds side 3-0 and playing some attractive football in the process

Unconvincing Alcuin firsts take the three points to secure last eight place

Alcuin firsts sealed progression to the quarter finals of the College Cup with a win over James seconds. With fatigue proving a factor in the heat, goals from Paul Reiss and Will Taylor were just enough to see them through against a battling James seconds team

Four for Garness as Derwent thirds stick five past Wentworth

On a hot Friday afternoon on the JLD, Derwent thirds saw themselves through to the Plate with a 5-1 hammering over Wentworth thirds

"It only took nine years" : The heartening story of AFC Wimbledon

"It only took 9 years" - Ziggy Heath chronicles the tale of AFC Wimbledon, one of the most heartening stories in modern football. (Thumbnail credit AFC fans celebrate after their play off final victory Image: rockinpaddy via flickr creative commons)

Bruce bags brace as Wenty run rings around Langwith

A rampant performance from Wentworth firsts against a depleted Langwith seconds cemented their place in the quarter-final stages of the College Cup

Halifax thirds beat Alcuin thirds to assure third place finish

Halifax thirds secured passage to the Plate this afternoon with a comfortable victory over the wooden spoon winners in group three, Alcuin thirds

Derwent sign off from group stages with another win

Goals from Xander Brinkworth and Dan Atherton allowed Derwent firsts to maintain their 100% record in this year's College Cup as they eased to a comfortable 2-0 win over Goodricke seconds (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Goodricke firsts pip Alcuin to go through unbeaten

A Sam Lewis penalty was enough to see Goodricke firsts into the quarter-finals of the College Cup yesterday afternoon on the final day of matches in Group 2

Vanbrugh win crucial match to top group and James thirds all but secure Cup progress

Looking down the four College Cup group tables one name sticks out with remarkable clarity. With one game to play and with one point in hand James thirds have been a compelling advert for the case that the gulf between first and third strings is narrowing, fast. Qualification is in their hands (Thumbnail credit James thirds have shocked everyone to top their group going into week six. Photo: Philippa Grafton)

Group stages enter their final week with thrills and spills guaranteed

A week is a long time in football. In the College Cup you can be staring down the barrel of elimination one day and staring down at your opponents from the top of the table the next, as the Vanbrugh first team will attest (Thumbnail credit Some unseasonable hail held up Halifax on their way to a 2-1 victory over James seconds on Thursday. Photo: Peter Iveson)
